Articles.Content: Do someone knows how to import old combined landing legs from 0.2.1 for example?

> 
> does anyone have configs for full USI-LS support, I tried making one but for whatever reason it gives all the parts negative costs ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

Uhm...what do you mean with full support for USI-LS? It is fully supported, you just need [ModuleManager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219-Module-Manager-1-5-6-%28Jan-6%29) to be able to use the parts.

As for the costs you have to add the costs for the resources that the parts can store. Which is a lot of funds for USI-LS. 

> 
> Do someone knows how to import old combined landing legs from 0.2.1 for example?

Just download the older mod and replace the *"PlanetaryBaseInc/Parts/Utility/habitat\_mk1\_g/LandingLeg.mu"* and the *"PlanetaryBaseInc/Parts/Structural/Adapter/LandingGear.mu"* files with the ones from the older version. That should be all. Sorry about the chaotic folder structure. I will have to clean this up some day.

So how is the performance with RPM transparency? Have you tested it with multiples of each part that uses it? Fustek has problems with some of its parts when lots of them are in the scene at once.

Having multiple transparent pods in the same craft, or indeed within physics range of each other, is one way to get a performance drop. As long as you can't actually see the other pods from the interior of one of them, however, you won't even notice that it won't show the insides of other pods when in IVA. I'd be interested to see how you're handling their retracted states along with the transparent windows. I've yet to ever see an IVA view that animated along with the outside part to reflect a change in dimensions or size.
